required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: VisiOn Restoration With FluidVisION Accommodating Intraocular Lens (AIOL)
clinical_study.official_title: VisiOn Restoration With the FluidVisION AIOL

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to obtain an initial assessment of the safety and performance of an investigational AIOL in patients undergoing cataract extraction and IOL implantation.

detailed_description.textblock: This study was originally designed as a single arm, unilateral study (one eye, one product only) to obtain an initial assessment of the safety and performance of an investigational IOL in subjects undergoing cataract extraction and IOL implantation. The study design was later modified to a contralateral study (both eyes, different product in each eye) to compare the safety and performance of the investigational IOL to a commercially available monofocal IOL.

primary_outcome.description: Accommodative amplitude is the ability of the eye to change its focus from distant to near objects.
Visual acuity was measured with distance correction (plus or minus power) in place.

primary_outcome.measure: International Organization for Standardization (ISO)-defined Cumulative and Persistent Adverse Events for Posterior Chamber IOL
primary_outcome.description: Adverse events were categorized per ISO 11979-7: Ophthalmic Implants - Intraocular Lenses - Part 7: Clinical Investigations.

secondary_outcome.description: Accommodative amplitude is a measure of the range of vision with good acuity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Minimum Add Power Required to Achieve Best Corrected Near Visual Acuity
secondary_outcome.description: Plus lenses were placed over the subject's best distance manifest correction.
Visual acuity was measured without correction in place.

arm_group.description: Implantation with the FluidVision AIOL in one eye during cataract surgery. Only one eye was treated.
Implantation with the FluidVision AIOL in the first eye during cataract surgery, followed by implantation with the AcrySof IQ monofocal IOL in the fellow eye during a subsequent cataract surgery

intervention.description: Investigational implantable medical device intended for long-term use over the lifetime of the cataract subject
Commercially available implantable medical device intended for long-term use over the lifetime of the cataract subject
